article.headline: Grambling beats Lyon 55-49
article.story: GRAMBLING, La. -- Shawn Walker earned his first victory as coach of Grambling State as the Tigers beat Lyon College 55-49 on Tuesday night. Walker spent the last 12 seasons at the helm of Division II Elizabeth City State. Grambling held Lyon College, a NAIA member, scoreless in the final 2 minutes. Remond Brown made one of two free throws to give Grambling (1-1) a 50-49 lead. Chase Cormier made a free throw, missed the second, but Kyle Williams grabbed the rebound. A'Torri Shine was fouled and hit both free throws. Brown closed out the scoring with a dunk. Williams' tip-in in the final seconds before halftime gave Grambling a 24-18 lead.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.
